Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman marked his return to the side with 81 runs as Pakistan beat Bangladesh by seven wickets at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.
Fakhar Zaman and Abdullah Shafique gave Pakistan an opening partnership of 100 runs.
Pakistan chased the target of 205 in 32.3 overs.
Pakistan’s pace bowlers combined to take eight wickets as Bangladesh were dismissed for 204 runs in 45.1 overs.
Mahmudullah managed a half-century for Bangladesh with 56 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan have kept alive their slim hopes of qualifying for the semifinals of the ICC Cricket World Cup.
The defeat has ended Shakib al-Hasan’s team’s hopes of qualifying for the semifinals.
Bangladesh have only won one match in the tournament.
Pakistan have now won three matches from their seven and still have a mathematical chance of qualifying.
Babar Azam’s men have moved to fifth place in the points table.
